programme.category: Série humoristique

programme.title: Ovni(s)
programme.desc: Marcel et Didier ont rendez-vous dans une chambre d'hôtel avec André. Une fois sur place, ils sont accueillis par Héléna Korska, l'assistante du physicien Andreï Sakharov. La jeune femme russe prétend que l'ancien chef du Gepan lui a donné rendez-vous dans cet hôtel pour lui remettre des preuves irréfutables sur l'existence des extraterrestres. De son côté, Véra quitte le Gepan pour devenir membre du mouvement du Nouvel ordre cosmique.

credits.actor: Melvil Poupaud
Michel Vuillermoz
Géraldine Pailhas
Quentin Dolmaire
Daphné Patakia
Jean-Charles Clichet
Laurent Poitrenaux

programme.category: Série humoristique

programme.title: Ovni(s)
programme.desc: Le Nouvel ordre cosmique, le mouvement spirituel lancé par Zorel, l'homme qui prétend avoir été enlévé par des extraterrestres, fait de nombreux adeptes. Au Cnes, la commission chargée d'enquêter sur l'explosion de la fusée à Kourou doit rendre ses conclusions. Bernard, l'un des responsables, est prêt à tout pour faire porter le chapeau à Didier. Ses chances d'intégrer l'Angence spatiale européenne sont désormais minces.

The investigation will push a young ambitious inspector to discover a heavy state secret." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10840070/","name":"Paris Police 1900","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY4NmNlYzQtOWI2NS00OTA1LTgzZjAtOTQzMzVmMDI4ZWVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Crime","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5398167/","name":"Jérémie Laheurte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2903342/","name":"Evelyne Brochu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5198870/","name":"Thibaut Evrard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0341057/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1942997/","name":"Fabien Nury"}],"datePublished":"2021-02-08","description":"Paris, France, 1899. The corpse of an unknown woman is found in the river Seine. The investigation will push a young ambitious inspector to discover a heavy state secret.","keywords":"investigation,french police,paris france,france,belle epoque","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10840070/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"searchanddestroy-1"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting but one big default....","reviewBody":"I admit that this series is very daring and inventive, especially for those craving for history matters, for people interested in facts never told before. This TV show is pulled by an awesome production design, supported by so many accurate details and problems which existed one hundred years ago. But this doesn't prevent the whole job to be messy, with no control of the story, a scheme where you have the feeling that are too much ingredients: crime, politics, drama, thriller, romance, comedy. The creator himself admitted to have insisted on the purpose to please ANYONE, to reach the largest audiences. I won't compare this strategy with CASA DEL PAPEL crap, though I perfectly could after all, but as I have already said, I hate this kind of point of view, reaching the largest audiences, because the result is not always the quality of the show. So, if you want to learn about French politics of the early 1900's, that OK, that's definitely for you. To summarize, that remains French on the shape, BUT not on the background, NOT on the message: to teach modern audiences what the politics of those years were.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":367,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sanma no aji
Le goût du saké
programme.desc: Sanma no aji: Directed by Yasujirô Ozu. With Chishû Ryû, Shima Iwashita, Keiji Sada, Mariko Okada. An aging widower arranges a marriage for his only daughter." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0056444/","name":"Sanma no aji","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWIxY2JkYTgtNjkxYS00NGFmLTgxMGEtOTYxMjBkNWQ2YzgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging widower arranges a marriage for his only daughter.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0056444/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zetes"},"dateCreated":"2002-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Ozu that I've heard so much about but couldn't find in his other films","reviewBody":"Not that I've seen too many Ozu films. This is only my third, after Bakushu and Tokyo Story. Both of those I found dull, even Tokyo Story, which is often considered one of the best films ever made. I don't know the critical reputation of Autumn Afternoon, but I liked it a lot. In fact, it continues with Ozus favorite themes (which I do sincerely hope aren't the same in all his films, and that I've just accidentally picked similar ones): aging, marriage, and Westernization. Autumn Afternoon is less pushy than those other two films. I thought that Ozu was making a lot of judgements in those films (although others have said that Ozu less judgemental than any other auteur; I don't believe it). In Autumn Afternoon, everything is observed without judgement. It's about life, it's about Japanese culture, and it's about human beings. I won't go into a deep examination of the film. I'd like to praise the musical score specifically, which is very charming and beautiful. Other than that, I'd just like to say that Autumn Afternoon is a delightful and touching film. See it if you're an Ozu fan, see it if you are not one. 9/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8491,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1962-11-18","keywords":"family relationships,existential loneliness,widower,japanese,tokyo japan","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753479/","name":"Chishû Ryû"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412615/","name":"Shima Iwashita"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0755401/","name":"Keiji Sada"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654868/","name":"Yasujirô Ozu"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007001/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0633792/","name":"Kôgo Noda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654868/","name":"Yasujirô Ozu"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Chishû Ryû (role=Shuhei Hirayama), Shima Iwashita (role=Michiko Hirayama), Keiji Sada (role=Koichi Hirayama), Mariko Okada (role=Akiko Hirayama), Teruo Yoshida (role=Yutaka Miura), Noriko Maki (role=Fusako Taguchi), Shin'ichirô Mikami (role=Kazuo Hirayama), Nobuo Nakamura (role=Shuzo Kawai), Eijirô Tôno (role=Sakuma - The 'Gourd'), Kuniko Miyake (role=Nobuko), Michiyo Tamaki (role=Tamako, gosai)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0056444, Title: Sanma no aji, --- Description: Sanma no aji: Directed by Yasujirô Ozu. With Chishû Ryû, Shima Iwashita, Keiji Sada, Mariko Okada. An aging widower arranges a marriage for his only daughter." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0056444/","name":"Sanma no aji","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWIxY2JkYTgtNjkxYS00NGFmLTgxMGEtOTYxMjBkNWQ2YzgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging widower arranges a marriage for his only daughter.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0056444/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"zetes","dateCreated":"2002-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Ozu that I've heard so much about but couldn't find in his other films","reviewBody":"Not that I've seen too many Ozu films. This is only my third, after Bakushu and Tokyo Story. Both of those I found dull, even Tokyo Story, which is often considered one of the best films ever made. I don't know the critical reputation of Autumn Afternoon, but I liked it a lot. In fact, it continues with Ozus favorite themes (which I do sincerely hope aren't the same in all his films, and that I've just accidentally picked similar ones): aging, marriage, and Westernization. Autumn Afternoon is less pushy than those other two films. I thought that Ozu was making a lot of judgements in those films (although others have said that Ozu less judgemental than any other auteur; I don't believe it). In Autumn Afternoon, everything is observed without judgement. It's about life, it's about Japanese culture, and it's about human beings. I won't go into a deep examination of the film. I'd like to praise the musical score specifically, which is very charming and beautiful. Other than that, I'd just like to say that Autumn Afternoon is a delightful and touching film. See it if you're an Ozu fan, see it if you are not one. 9/10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8491,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1962-11-18","keywords":"family relationships,existential loneliness,widower,japanese,tokyo japan","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753479/","name":"Chishû Ryû","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412615/","name":"Shima Iwashita","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0755401/","name":"Keiji Sada"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654868/","name":"Yasujirô Ozu"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007001/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0633792/","name":"Kôgo Noda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654868/","name":"Yasujirô Ozu"],"duration":"PT1H53M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Michel Strogoff
Michel Strogoff
programme.desc:
Michel Strogoff: Directed by Carmine Gallone. With Curd Jürgens, Geneviève Page, Jacques Dacqmine, Sylva Koscina. In 19th century Russia, a Tartar rebellion led by Feofar Khan separates Russia from Siberia where the Tsar's brother and his troops are making a last stand. The Tsar entrusts Captain Michel Strogoff to deliver a vital message to them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0049501/","name":"Michel Strogoff","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRkNjBmNDYtYWMyYS00MTY3LWE3ZTktODFhOWRmOGRmYjc5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzA4ODc3ODU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 19th century Russia, a Tartar rebellion led by Feofar Khan separates Russia from Siberia where the Tsar's brother and his troops are making a last stand. The Tsar entrusts Captain Michel Strogoff to deliver a vital message to them","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0049501/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Oh no!Not my mother!","reviewBody":"Although Verne's famous novel has been filmed many many times,this one made number one at the 1956 French box office ;it was so commercially successful that a sequel was made afterward.

Okay ,Curd Jurgends (41) is too old for the part of the dashing young officer but he is efficient and handsome and he and Genevieve Page make a nice pair.You can notice other lovely actresses in supporting parts:Sylva Koscina ,the sword and sandal queen ,and Françoise Fabian ,who would turn into a rather intellectual thespian as the years went passing by .Sylvie ,a seasoned actress ,appears as Marfa Strogoff.

The screenplay is faithful to the novel,including the famous scene of torture with the red-hot iron .

Gallone's effort thoroughly deserved its success ;it was made for the whole family and can,from that point of view,be considered good Entertainment."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":460,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Adventure","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"1956-12-14","keywords":"character name as title,two word title,michel strogoff character,tsar,russia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0432007/","name":"Curd Jürgens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0656180/","name":"Geneviève Page"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0196541/","name":"Jacques Dacqmine"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0303120/","name":"Carmine Gallone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009003/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066427/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0767163/","name":"Marc-Gilbert Sauvajon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0894523/","name":"Jules Verne"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Les coeurs verts
Les coeurs verts
programme.desc:
Les coeurs verts: Directed by Édouard Luntz. With Gérard Zimmermann, Eric Penet, Marise Maire, Françoise Bonneau. Outside at night. Tower of lodgings. A syncopated jazz accompanies the successive appearances of young people in front of the camera. Zim, delivered to the police by locals for stealing gasoline, ends up in jail. On the day of his release, he meets Jean-Pierre, who has just been released from the same Parisian jail. The two youngsters become friends. Back in the suburb, Zim decides to find a job and tries to convince Jean-Pierre to go with him - without success." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0060247/","name":"Les coeurs verts","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2M5MzE0ZmQtZWQxMy00NTVlLTllNDItY2U2OTllYmY3MDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIzNTcxOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outside at night. Tower of lodgings. A syncopated jazz accompanies the successive appearances of young people in front of the camera. Zim, delivered to the police by locals for stealing gasoline, ends up in jail. On the day of his re","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0060247/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Let me goooooooo!","reviewBody":"The ending (which echoes to the first sequences ) seems to indicate that ,when you were born on the wrong side of town, you got a raw deal ,and whatever you may do to escape from a doomed fate,it 's in vain .

In 1966 ,this movie was at odds with the whole production : a chronicle of underdogs in a drab urban area (always present ;when the hero and his girl friend have a walk , a panoramic shows the suburban area just behind them.

When you're just out of jail ,it's hard to integrate into a society where young men were born silver spoon in hand (see the ball scene with the guys in suit and tie ; the girl getting in a rich kid's sports car) and always have a papa who can take them off the hook with a good lawyer. But your dad is an alcoholic on the dole and mom 's complaining she's the only one to work -the parents have only one scene ,and it sums up the young hero's plight in an admirably succint style .

Even when he finds a job as a roofer , he meets the generation gap : their elder can't stand the wild pop music and dance to the musette (popular dance to the accordion).

The sequence of the ball may be too long ,but it allows the social mixing:theres's nothing in common between the clean-cut kids and the riff-raff , the sixties music ,contrary to received ideas , doesn't create a bond between them .

The girls are treated as sex objects whom the boys share with their pack ; when the hero realizes that ,without a true love of his own, he's always so left alone ,it will to be late ."I can take my pick too" the girl says ,but it's not really women's lib (it's historically too soon) :she'll opt for another boy (maybe the leader of the pack) or flirt with the rich boy in this brand new car (to whom she's only a prey he will leave after he gets what he wants),but she'll end like the hero's mom .

After this black and white realistic movie ,far ahead of its time , Edouard Luntz never confirmed his promises ;"le dernier saut" was a most inadequate follow-up to "les coeurs verts"","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":75,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1966-11-30","keywords":"teenage boy,stealing gas,voice over,arrest,police arrest","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0956832/","name":"Gérard Zimmermann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671786/","name":"Eric Penet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537856/","name":"Marise Maire"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0526815/","name":"Édouard Luntz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0580043/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0526815/","name":"Édouard Luntz"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Little Fugitive
Le petit fugitif
programme.desc: Little Fugitive: Directed by Ray Ashley, Morris Engel, Ruth Orkin. With Richard Brewster, Winifred Cushing, Jay Williams, Will Lee. A young boy fears that he shot his older brother, who is only faking. He then runs away to Coney Island, a crowded beach area, and gets money by returning soda bottles for their deposits." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0046004/","name":"Little Fugitive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0OTU0NTIwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjY0NTEyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young boy fears that he shot his older brother, who is only faking. He then runs away to Coney Island, a crowded beach area, and gets money by returning soda bottles for their deposits.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0046004/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"imarciaj"},"dateCreated":"2000-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"remembrance","reviewBody":"As children growing up in Brooklyn in the 50's, this was my brother's and my very favorite Sat. afternoon movie. As an adult, reaching back for things of value to proffer to my children, I was delighted to find that this was still available, though bemused by the high critical acclaim and near cult status. I loved this movie because it spoke to me- I knew how the beach smelled after a rain, how much Joey longed to ride that pony, how the peculiar torture by an older brother could be forgiven and forgotten by a moment's offhand kindness (and a little guilt). Cinema verite notwithstanding, this was the truest movie of a real adventure I'd ever seen, and wonderful"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2657,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"1953-12-16","keywords":"national film registry,coney island,younger brother,older brother,harmonica","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Little Fugitive","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1150484761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI4YmExNWMtMmIwOC00YTQyLWIzYTYtZGYxNzMxZmE0Yzc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI4YmExNWMtMmIwOC00YTQyLWIzYTYtZGYxNzMxZmE0Yzc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Kino Lorber, Inc."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0108298/","name":"Richard Brewster"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193705/","name":"Winifred Cushing"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0930864/","name":"Jay Williams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0039107/","name":"Ray Ashley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0257129/","name":"Morris Engel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649907/","name":"Ruth Orkin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0115517/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0039107/","name":"Ray Ashley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0257129/","name":"Morris Engel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649907/","name":"Ruth Orkin"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Trials of Oscar Wilde
Les procès d'Oscar Wilde
programme.desc:
The Trials of Oscar Wilde: Directed by Ken Hughes. With Peter Finch, Yvonne Mitchell, James Mason, Nigel Patrick. A chronicle of Oscar Wilde's libel suit against the Marquis of Queensberry and the tragic turn his life takes because of it." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054403/","name":"The Trials of Oscar Wilde","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRjYzBjMDMtYWNkMi00YTIzLWE3MjUtYmQ1OTQ2YmMwNWNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUyNDk2ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A chronicle of Oscar Wilde's libel suit against the Marquis of Queensberry and the tragic turn his life takes because of it.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054403/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pekinman"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's holding up very well after 40+ years","reviewBody":"Ken Hughes film 'The Trials of Oscar Wilde' may at first appear to be one of those cheesy Technicolor costume dramas when in fact it is a gripping and finely acted account of the appalling treatment Oscar Wilde received at the hands of the English justice system at the end of the 19th century.

Peter Finch is superb as the eponymous hero and is totally committed to the role and turns in one of his best performances on screen. The supporting cast is also quite good if more generalized in their characterizations, more a fault of the screenplay than the performers. There is one especially fine supporting performance from Lionel Jeffries as the maniacal Lord Queensbury. Jeffries plays Queensbury as a crazed brute, a type of man we can no longer countenance in these days, though I suspect they are still out there waiting for their chance to pounce on those who they fear and do not understand.

Sonia Dresdel is Lady Wilde, Oscar's dotty mother at the end of her life. It's a small part but is quietly powerful. Other people in Wilde's life, Constance, his wife, and Ada Leverson, his stalwart friend and life-long supporter, are tantalizingly glimpsed but little is revealed of their inner workings. But this isn't a film about them but about the actual trials and much of the film is spent in courtrooms. This might sound boring but it isn't.

James Mason appears in the first trial as the defending witness, for Lord Queensbury, and a more vicious, narrow-minded lawyer could hardly be found, even these days.

The technical credits are competent if nothing special; the music, melodramatic in a soap-opera-ish way, the sets plush and too clean. But somehow the power and tragedy of Wilde's story comes through all the gilding of the script, peppered with some of Wilde's wiser quotes, well-placed, naturally, in the text. There is nothing preachy or moralistic which is a relief, compared to the highly politicized scripts being written since this film was made.

It is interesting to note Nicholas Roeg as the camera operator. He wasn't the cinematographer but I detected a few Roeg-ish touches in a couple of the more meditative scenes.

This is not a film to be sluffed off as old-fashioned simply because there are no sex scenes or vulgar language or violence. The psychic violence suffered by Oscar Wilde was quite sufficient enough and this is a memorable film, worth having in the collection."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":888,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"keywords":"homophobia,homosexual history,based on true story,oscar wilde character,lord alfred douglas character","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002075/","name":"Peter Finch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593814/","name":"Yvonne Mitchell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000051/","name":"James Mason"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103268/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103296/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0405007/","name":"Montgomery Hyde"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0299019/","name":"John Furnell"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

A chronicle of Oscar Wilde's libel suit against the Marquis of Queensberry and the tragic turn his life takes because of it." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054403/","name":"The Trials of Oscar Wilde","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRjYzBjMDMtYWNkMi00YTIzLWE3MjUtYmQ1OTQ2YmMwNWNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUyNDk2ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A chronicle of Oscar Wilde's libel suit against the Marquis of Queensberry and the tragic turn his life takes because of it.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054403/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"pekinman","dateCreated":"2004-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's holding up very well after 40+ years","reviewBody":"Ken Hughes film 'The Trials of Oscar Wilde' may at first appear to be one of those cheesy Technicolor costume dramas when in fact it is a gripping and finely acted account of the appalling treatment Oscar Wilde received at the hands of the English justice system at the end of the 19th century.

Peter Finch is superb as the eponymous hero and is totally committed to the role and turns in one of his best performances on screen. The supporting cast is also quite good if more generalized in their characterizations, more a fault of the screenplay than the performers. There is one especially fine supporting performance from Lionel Jeffries as the maniacal Lord Queensbury. Jeffries plays Queensbury as a crazed brute, a type of man we can no longer countenance in these days, though I suspect they are still out there waiting for their chance to pounce on those who they fear and do not understand.

Sonia Dresdel is Lady Wilde, Oscar's dotty mother at the end of her life. It's a small part but is quietly powerful. Other people in Wilde's life, Constance, his wife, and Ada Leverson, his stalwart friend and life-long supporter, are tantalizingly glimpsed but little is revealed of their inner workings. But this isn't a film about them but about the actual trials and much of the film is spent in courtrooms. This might sound boring but it isn't.

James Mason appears in the first trial as the defending witness, for Lord Queensbury, and a more vicious, narrow-minded lawyer could hardly be found, even these days.

The technical credits are competent if nothing special; the music, melodramatic in a soap-opera-ish way, the sets plush and too clean. But somehow the power and tragedy of Wilde's story comes through all the gilding of the script, peppered with some of Wilde's wiser quotes, well-placed, naturally, in the text. There is nothing preachy or moralistic which is a relief, compared to the highly politicized scripts being written since this film was made.

It is interesting to note Nicholas Roeg as the camera operator. He wasn't the cinematographer but I detected a few Roeg-ish touches in a couple of the more meditative scenes.

This is not a film to be sluffed off as old-fashioned simply because there are no sex scenes or vulgar language or violence. The psychic violence suffered by Oscar Wilde was quite sufficient enough and this is a memorable film, worth having in the collection.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":888,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"keywords":"homophobia,homosexual history,based on true story,oscar wilde character,lord alfred douglas character","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002075/","name":"Peter Finch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593814/","name":"Yvonne Mitchell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000051/","name":"James Mason"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103268/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103296/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0405007/","name":"Montgomery Hyde","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0299019/","name":"John Furnell"],"duration":"PT2H3M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La tête d'un homme
La tête d'un homme
programme.desc: La tête d'un homme: Directed by Julien Duvivier. With Harry Baur, Valéry Inkijinoff, Gina Manès, Alexandre Rignault. Willy is broke and his mistress always wants more money. A stranger in a pub agrees to murder his aunt, but everything will not go as planned. Maigret will try to separate fact and fiction." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0024710/","name":"La tête d'un homme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTEwNTNjZmQtOTYzNS00MDUxLTk3MGMtOGY2ZGRhYjNkZDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzg1ODEwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Willy is broke and his mistress always wants more money. A stranger in a pub agrees to murder his aunt, but everything will not go as planned. Maigret will try to separate fact and fiction.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0024710/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob998"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Mediocre Simenon adaptation","reviewBody":"I am a passionate Maigret enthusiast, and it was a disappointment to see the weak and charmless film that Duvivier made of one of Simenon's better novels. Harry Baur acts as though he couldn't care less about the story or his part, while Gina Manes as the cheap gold-digging mistress of a homicidal wastrel gives a very bland performance. The only spirit in the whole show comes from Valery Inkijinoff as the terminally ill killer Radek, a man who has plenty of reasons to live it up, since he's living on borrowed time. Some fine camerawork from Armand Thirard does not make this film worth seeing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":565,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Crime","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1933-02-18","keywords":"paris france,inheritance,shoe print,chalkline of body,1930s","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0062428/","name":"Harry Baur"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0409105/","name":"Valéry Inkijinoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0544539/","name":"Gina Manès"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0245213/","name":"Julien Duvivier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147182/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799442/","name":"Georges Simenon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0216457/","name":"Louis Delaprée"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0130619/","name":"Pierre Calmann"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

La taverne du poisson couronné
programme.desc: La taverne du poisson couronné: Directed by René Chanas. With Michel Simon, Jules Berry, Raymond Bussières, Blanchette Brunoy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0200201/","name":"La taverne du poisson couronné","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTVkMDc3ZWYtZTU2OS00MWI2LWI1MTEtMjJhZWY2ZWRkYjZkL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjM4NzIzNTE@._V1_.jpg","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0200201/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Captain Lear","reviewBody":"There's good news: Michel Simon and Jules Berry in the same movie is always cause for celebration ;besides Blanchette Brunoy,generally cast as the nice young girl next door ,finds here an ambiguous part,which makes her look like king Lear's ungrateful daughter .\n\nBut there's also bad news ,which may account for the very low IMDb rating of the movie;the screenplay is rather weak and conventional,borrowing from many movies made before the war,from "Quai Des Brumes " to " Mollenard ,Capitaine Corsaire " (the ending of the latter is similar).Plus an interminable free-for-all in the tavern of the title (the crowned fish tavern)during which a murder is committed ."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1947-12-10","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800302/","name":"Michel Simon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077598/","name":"Jules Berry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0124482/","name":"Raymond Bussières"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0151200/","name":"René Chanas"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0151200/","name":"René Chanas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0291043/","name":"Nino Frank"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0419986/","name":"Henri Jeanson"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mannen på taket
Un flic sur le toit
programme.desc:
Mannen på taket: Directed by Bo Widerberg. With Carl-Gustaf Lindstedt, Sven Wollter, Thomas Hellberg, Håkan Serner. When a police inspector is murdered in hospital, the investigation led by detective Martin Beck uncovers reports of police misconduct and a possible revenge motive." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0074857/","name":"Mannen på taket","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGVmZTA4MTAtMzRmYy00MjU2LTgyMWQtNmM3MWNhOGE5Y2I1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQxNDExNTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a police inspector is murdered in hospital, the investigation led by detective Martin Beck uncovers reports of police misconduct and a possible revenge motive.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0074857/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"HGH-3"},"dateCreated":"1999-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Top notch police action","reviewBody":"This was the first attempt to mix social comment and action in a Swedish movie. Bo Widerberg had previously tried, successfully, the social comment. This time he tried action for the first time. And without a doubt he succeeded.

It's about police brutality and a victims attempt to seek revenge. The only trouble is that he doesn't think it's enough to kill the police who was the cause of his anger, but he tries to kill every policeman that comes in sight.

It shows the routines in police-work, as well as fabulous action sequences. The camera-work is brilliant. Notice the sequence when the camera moves backwards with enormous speed in front of the policemen running down the stairs at the subway-station. Steady-cam wasn't invented yet.

Brilliant acting galore. Carl-Gustaf Lindstedt playing the Martin Beck part, was really a comedian, not a serious actor. He did a great job, especially in the balcony scene, which was a very painful experience for him.

If you don't like looking at blood, close your eyes when the curtain opens in the first scene of the film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3986,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1976-10-01","keywords":"roof,policeman,police,hospital,murder","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0512432/","name":"Carl-Gustaf Lindstedt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0938623/","name":"Sven Wollter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0375219/","name":"Thomas Hellberg"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0927090/","name":"Bo Widerberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048118/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050989/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0803711/","name":"Maj Sjöwall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0883908/","name":"Per Wahlöö"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0927090/","name":"Bo Widerberg"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tarawa Beachhead
Tarawa, tête de pont
programme.desc: Tarawa Beachhead: Directed by Paul Wendkos. With Kerwin Mathews, Julie Adams, Ray Danton, Karen Sharpe. A marine sergeant witnesses a captain kill one of their men at Guadalcanal to cover his own incompetence, and fears he won't be believed because of rank, so finds the captain has gotten him assigned to his next command plus is cozying up to the family of his victim." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0052272/","name":"Tarawa Beachhead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzMzgyZjItMjlhNy00NmJiLWI1OGMtOGU1OGExZWZmYzAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzg1ODEwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A marine sergeant witnesses a captain kill one of their men at Guadalcanal to cover his own incompetence, and fears he won't be believed because of rank, so finds the captain has gotten him assigned to his next command plus is cozyin","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0052272/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rogersde"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"B Movie Reuses Scenes from "Sands of Iwo Jima"","reviewBody":"Meh, it's a B movie from the 50s, running only 77 minutes. It's not terrible, but don't expect to see much that's accurate about the Battle of Tarawa...except perhaps for the justification for choosing the Central Pacific route to Japan rather than going exclusively through Australia, New Guinea, and the Philippines. As in "Battle Cry," another film concerning the 2nd Marine Division prior to Tarawa, much of the film is set in New Zealand, but some of the purported Kiwis have accents from no farther west than California and hair styles no older than the late 1950s. If you've seen "Sands of Iwo Jima," you'll recognize much of the battle and beach footage, just stuck into this movie in between dialogue scenes in order to avoid having to pay to stage it again, I guess. Some accurate, some inaccurate combat film is inserted; as for the latter, amphibious tanks and vehicles with Army markings spoil the mood if you're trying to get a feel for the real Tarawa, as do broad, sandy beaches and lush, intact vegetation. The hatred between the main characters is well done, and the villain is a good mix of hero and coward. The trope of the woman burned badly by losing a husband at war and determined never to fall in love again is on full display (as in "Battle Cry" and "The Americanization of Emily").","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":106,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1958-11-02","keywords":"explosion,hand grenade,rifle,m1 rifle,u.s. marines","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558663/","name":"Kerwin Mathews"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011105/","name":"Julie Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200645/","name":"Ray Danton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920862/","name":"Paul Wendkos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072431/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671766/","name":"Richard Alan Simmons"}],"duration":"PT1H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: M*A*S*H
M.A.S.H.
programme.desc:
M*A*S*H: Directed by Robert Altman. With Donald Sutherland, Elliott Gould, Tom Skerritt, Sally Kellerman. The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0066026/","name":"M*A*S*H","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjNjM2NlN2MtOWYyOS00NmY5LThhYjMtMDc1Y2U4OTU4MDNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMwNDgzNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0066026/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"runamokprods"},"dateCreated":"2010-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Clearly an important part of film history, but the years haven't been kind to it (in my eyes)","reviewBody":"I should probably watch this again, since so many consider it a masterpiece. Maybe I was over-prepared (Hey, it took me a second viewing of 'Citizen Kane' to get my past pre-set expectations!). But while I could see why M*A*S*H was groundbreaking and important for a Hollywood film of it's day (lack of the usual clear narrative line, anti-war stance, overlapping, improvised dialogue, sexuality, bloody operating room scenes serving as ironic counterpart, etc), it felt pretty dated and unfocused. There are some very funny moments, but a lot of the ironies seem easy, and there's a lack of a true darker underpinnings and ideas, unlike, say, 'Dr. Strangelove'. 

A lot of the humor is juvenile, cruel and silly. And while I get that's the point – nothing can be more deeply juvenile, cruel and silly than war, it got repetitive and heavy handed after a while. The performances are good, but beyond Robert Duvall, none of the characters have much in the way of dimensions. People stay exactly what we think they are from the moment we meet them. 

Walter Chow makes a good argument on the web site 'Film Freak Central', that the sexism, homophobia, etc are the whole point. Altman is saying we're ALL beasts at heart, even if we act like we're bucking the system. It's an interesting idea, but I'm not sure I buy it's what Altman was intending.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69797,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1970-03-18","keywords":"surgeon,nurse,satire,black comedy,irreverence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mash","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3013083417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjc1OWRiYjctZDE4Ni00YWNlLTgwZTEtOWQ0YWZkZGUwNmNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjc1OWRiYjctZDE4Ni00YWNlLTgwZTEtOWQ0YWZkZGUwNmNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000661/","name":"Donald Sutherland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001285/","name":"Elliott Gould"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000643/","name":"Tom Skerritt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000265/","name":"Robert Altman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029048/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046078/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393645/","name":"Richard Hooker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0488057/","name":"Ring Lardner Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Giulietta degli spiriti
Juliette des esprits
programme.desc: Giulietta degli spiriti: Directed by Federico Fellini. With Giulietta Masina, Sandra Milo, Mario Pisu, Valentina Cortese. Visions, memories, and mysticism all help a 40-something woman to find the strength to leave her cheating husband." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0059229/","name":"Giulietta degli spiriti","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2U4OWQ3MjEtYTQ4Zi00MDY1LTg2YjgtNmJkNzI3MTM1YjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzM0MTUwNTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Visions, memories, and mysticism all help a 40-something woman to find the strength to leave her cheating husband.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0059229/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brogmiller"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"My life is filled with people who talk, talk, talk!","reviewBody":"A masterpiece of 'baroque' film-making or just rambling and self-indulgent? Opinions on this first colour film of Fellini will always be divided. Superlative production values of course, technical virtuosity and a tantalising cast but this remains nonetheless a film without 'heart' which is less about character than about caricature whilst attempts to make the talented but diminutive Giulietta Masina look 'chic' are not entirely successful. I am glad to have finally seen this stylish exercise but would I wish to see it again? Probably not.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12906,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1965-10-22","keywords":"italy,black cat,eccentricity,bourgeoisie,french maid","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3093020441","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmQ2NDQyNGEtNjliYS00NjQxLWE4ZWItZjEzMjM0YTEwYzE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmQ2NDQyNGEtNjliYS00NjQxLWE4ZWItZjEzMjM0YTEwYzE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0556399/","name":"Giulietta Masina"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590452/","name":"Sandra Milo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0685609/","name":"Mario Pisu"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000019/","name":"Federico Fellini"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062467/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061252/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000019/","name":"Federico Fellini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684083/","name":"Tullio Pinelli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0280919/","name":"Ennio Flaiano"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0059229, Title: Giulietta degli spiriti, --- Description: Giulietta degli spiriti: Directed by Federico Fellini. With Giulietta Masina, Sandra Milo, Mario Pisu, Valentina Cortese. Visions, memories, and mysticism all help a 40-something woman to find the strength to leave her cheating husband." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0059229/","name":"Giulietta degli spiriti","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2U4OWQ3MjEtYTQ4Zi00MDY1LTg2YjgtNmJkNzI3MTM1YjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzM0MTUwNTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Visions, memories, and mysticism all help a 40-something woman to find the strength to leave her cheating husband.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0059229/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"brogmiller","dateCreated":"2020-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"My life is filled with people who talk, talk, talk!","reviewBody":"A masterpiece of 'baroque' film-making or just rambling and self-indulgent? Opinions on this first colour film of Fellini will always be divided. Superlative production values of course, technical virtuosity and a tantalising cast but this remains nonetheless a film without 'heart' which is less about character than about caricature whilst attempts to make the talented but diminutive Giulietta Masina look 'chic' are not entirely successful. I am glad to have finally seen this stylish exercise but would I wish to see it again? programme.title: Mamá cumple 100 años
Maman a cent ans
programme.desc:
Mamá cumple 100 años: Directed by Carlos Saura. With Geraldine Chaplin, Amparo Muñoz, Fernando Fernán Gómez, Norman Briski. Ana is alive and married with Antonio; they arrive in the manor in the countryside of Spain where she worked as a nanny many years ago, for the centennial birthday of the matriarch. In their reunion, she finds that Jose died three years ago; Juan left his wife Luchy; Fernando is still living with his mother and unsuccessfully trying to fly a hang glider; and the three little girls are grown-up. Further, she discovers that the dysfunctional family is completely broken, and Luchy in embezzling mother's money. When Juan arrives for the celebration, he plots with Fernando and Luchy to kill the mother to get the inheritance. Meanwhile, Antonio has a brief affair with Natalia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079517/","name":"Mamá cumple 100 años","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDJmNTdlNTktNDk5Yy00ZGU2LTllMzgtNmYxZWI0Nzg5ZjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ana is alive and married with Antonio; they arrive in the manor in the countryside of Spain where she worked as a nanny many years ago, for the centennial birthday of the matriarch. In their reunion, she finds that Jose died three ye","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079517/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Miksa76"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grandma is 100 years old","reviewBody":"This is one hilarious film. I remember watching it over and over again on our VCR when I was about 12 years old. I recall being fascinated with this fantastic family, which was nothing like our bleak, Scandinavian existence! I saw it about 10 times...

It's about the grandma's centennial birthday, which gathers together all the family, with their marital and family problems. Some have schemes and plots to embezzle the family's money. The themes also deal with generation-gap and cultural environment in Franco's Spain. However, the Grandma is larger-than-life figure, almost akin to the creations of magical realism. She's able to have, for example, a telepathic connection with her granddaughter. Her son Federico is a "mad scientist" and a dreamer.

The whole film is set in the country house and it's surroundings. All the characters are colourful and rich, funny and tragical. The actress playing the Grand old lady does a terrific job!! Besides, the film is well shot, and the music echoes richly in memories of the persons.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1178,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1979-11-07","keywords":"full frontal female nudity,attempted flight,memory,hang glider,glider","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001036/","name":"Geraldine Chaplin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616361/","name":"Amparo Muñoz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0273178/","name":"Fernando Fernán Gómez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0767022/","name":"Carlos Saura"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020931/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065243/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060888/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0767022/","name":"Carlos Saura"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Spalicek
L'année tchèque
programme.desc:
Spalicek: Directed by Jirí Trnka. Puppet animation feature consisting of different segments related to the traditions and emotions of the seasons as a typical year passes among the Czech people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0227528/","name":"Spalicek","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU0ZDg5ZDQtNjFkMS00YTQ1LTk1MmItNTNlNDEyZGYzM2RlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDUxNjc5NjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Puppet animation feature consisting of different segments related to the traditions and emotions of the seasons as a typical year passes among the Czech people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0227528/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"The seasons","reviewBody":"It is always interesting seeing stop motion animation and especially the older stop motion animation. It can be old-fashioned but very charmingly so, have more often than not found it lovely to watch and at its best magical. Never being too crude or trying to do too much. What has been seen of Jiri Trnka's work is really quite impressive and he and his films are deserving of more credit now if gems such as 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (review to come) is to come by.

'The Czech Year' is another lovely film of his and a very well done tribute to the seasons and the traditions that come with them, with a good concept that is not wasted. Did like the structure, with a series of segments revolving around each season of the year (hence the title) and 'The Czech Year' does a very nice job with it. Though do agree that 'The Czech Seasons' would have been a slightly more fitting title. As far as Trnka's films go, this is one of his best and one of his most interesting, subject-wise it is quite different for him.

Perfect 'The Czech Year' isn't. Those not familiar with the Czech language and/or the older stop motion/puppet animation style, on top of perhaps a more deliberate pace may find themselves alienated on first glance, so 'The Czech Year' is perhaps not the best place to start getting into Trnka's films. 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' is perhaps a better choice for introduction.

Flaws are very few though, with the only major issue being the pace being over-deliberate in spots especially in the slighter sections.

Visually however, 'The Czech Year' looks great. The characters are detailed and full of life and the sceneries are colourful and atmospheric, old-fashioned yes but in an endearing way. The music is full of energy and beauty of tone, with a real feel for the period and a nostalgic Czech folklore vibe at times. The sung words don't ramble or get cheesy or schmaltzy. The characters are as alive in personality as they are in look and are engaging.

While the story is basically a series of segments revolving around the seasons, this is handled cleverly and not in too episodic a way. Actually found myself learning a good deal about the beautiful to watch and interesting seasonal traditions and emotionally it's done beautifully. Very slight and uneventful on occasions, but very charming and fascinates a good deal. The writing is not used too much and has a nice variety of tone.

Concluding, well worth seeing. 8/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Animation"],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0873240/","name":"Jirí Trnka"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114156/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093976/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114183/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0873240/","name":"Jirí Trnka"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

It can be old-fashioned but very charmingly so, have more often than not found it lovely to watch and at its best magical. Never being too crude or trying to do too much. What has been seen of Jiri Trnka's work is really quite impressive and he and his films are deserving of more credit now if gems such as 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (review to come) is to come by.

'The Czech Year' is another lovely film of his and a very well done tribute to the seasons and the traditions that come with them, with a good concept that is not wasted. Did like the structure, with a series of segments revolving around each season of the year (hence the title) and 'The Czech Year' does a very nice job with it. Though do agree that 'The Czech Seasons' would have been a slightly more fitting title. As far as Trnka's films go, this is one of his best and one of his most interesting, subject-wise it is quite different for him.

Perfect 'The Czech Year' isn't. Those not familiar with the Czech language and/or the older stop motion/puppet animation style, on top of perhaps a more deliberate pace may find themselves alienated on first glance, so 'The Czech Year' is perhaps not the best place to start getting into Trnka's films. 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' is perhaps a better choice for introduction.

Flaws are very few though, with the only major issue being the pace being over-deliberate in spots especially in the slighter sections.

Visually however, 'The Czech Year' looks great. The characters are detailed and full of life and the sceneries are colourful and atmospheric, old-fashioned yes but in an endearing way. The music is full of energy and beauty of tone, with a real feel for the period and a nostalgic Czech folklore vibe at times. The sung words don't ramble or get cheesy or schmaltzy. The characters are as alive in personality as they are in look and are engaging.

While the story is basically a series of segments revolving around the seasons, this is handled cleverly and not in too episodic a way. Actually found myself learning a good deal about the beautiful to watch and interesting seasonal traditions and emotionally it's done beautifully. Very slight and uneventful on occasions, but very charming and fascinates a good deal. The writing is not used too much and has a nice variety of tone.

Concluding, well worth seeing. 8/10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"genre":["Animation"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0873240/","name":"Jirí Trnka"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114156/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093976/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114183/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0873240/","name":"Jirí Trnka"],"duration":"PT1H15M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Martine Carol, plus dure sera la chute
Falbalas
Falbalas
programme.desc: Falbalas: Directed by Jacques Becker. With Raymond Rouleau, Micheline Presle, Jean Chevrier, Gabrielle Dorziat. Philippe Clarence, a famous Parisian dressmaker, seduces his friend's fiancee. But, for the 1st time in his life, this is for real. The film is also a sharp picture of the fashion world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0035853/","name":"Falbalas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWUwNDU2YTMtZWJlOC00YzAwLThiNjQtY2Q5MzQwYWFlM2JkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM2NTg3Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Philippe Clarence, a famous Parisian dressmaker, seduces his friend's fiancee. But, for the 1st time in his life, this is for real. The film is also a sharp picture of the fashion world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0035853/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"richardchatten"},"dateCreated":"2017-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Frills & Spills","reviewBody":"The first of Jacques Becker's films to bear the credit "Un film de Jacques Becker", thus attesting to his growing stature within the industry. \n\nHaving essayed a French equivalent of 'Cold Comfort Farm' during the Occupation with 'Goupi Mains Rouges', Becker next made a characteristic about turn to provide a bit of glossy escapism shot before the Liberation but released in 1945 with this hothouse drama set within the frivolous and insulated world of Parisian haute couture. Christian Dior's 'New Look' being still two years away, the woman all wear wartime padded suits and terrifying frizzy big hair, through the midst of which struts the fox in this henhouse, designer Raymond Rouleau, who exercises droit du seigneur with a new model played by a baby-faced Micheline Presle before he comes a spectacular cropper when he becomes genuinely besotted with her.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1946-03-15","keywords":"1940s,one word title,haute couture,fashion designer,fashion house","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745700/","name":"Raymond Rouleau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0696163/","name":"Micheline Presle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0156761/","name":"Jean Chevrier"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065442/","name":"Jacques Becker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030039/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0270091/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0041279/","name":"Maurice Aubergé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065442/","name":"Jacques Becker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0341071/","name":"Maurice Griffe"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Tarawa Beachhead: Directed by Paul Wendkos. With Kerwin Mathews, Julie Adams, Ray Danton, Karen Sharpe. A marine sergeant witnesses a captain kill one of their men at Guadalcanal to cover his own incompetence, and fears he won't be believed because of rank, so finds the captain has gotten him assigned to his next command plus is cozying up to the family of his victim." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0052272/","name":"Tarawa Beachhead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzMzgyZjItMjlhNy00NmJiLWI1OGMtOGU1OGExZWZmYzAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzg1ODEwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A marine sergeant witnesses a captain kill one of their men at Guadalcanal to cover his own incompetence, and fears he won't be believed because of rank, so finds the captain has gotten him assigned to his next command plus is cozyin","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0052272/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rogersde"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"B Movie Reuses Scenes from "Sands of Iwo Jima"","reviewBody":"Meh, it's a B movie from the 50s, running only 77 minutes. It's not terrible, but don't expect to see much that's accurate about the Battle of Tarawa...except perhaps for the justification for choosing the Central Pacific route to Japan rather than going exclusively through Australia, New Guinea, and the Philippines. As in "Battle Cry," another film concerning the 2nd Marine Division prior to Tarawa, much of the film is set in New Zealand, but some of the purported Kiwis have accents from no farther west than California and hair styles no older than the late 1950s. If you've seen "Sands of Iwo Jima," you'll recognize much of the battle and beach footage, just stuck into this movie in between dialogue scenes in order to avoid having to pay to stage it again, I guess. Some accurate, some inaccurate combat film is inserted; as for the latter, amphibious tanks and vehicles with Army markings spoil the mood if you're trying to get a feel for the real Tarawa, as do broad, sandy beaches and lush, intact vegetation. The hatred between the main characters is well done, and the villain is a good mix of hero and coward. The trope of the woman burned badly by losing a husband at war and determined never to fall in love again is on full display (as in "Battle Cry" and "The Americanization of Emily").","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":106,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1958-11-02","keywords":"explosion,hand grenade,rifle,m1 rifle,u.s. marines","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558663/","name":"Kerwin Mathews"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011105/","name":"Julie Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200645/","name":"Ray Danton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920862/","name":"Paul Wendkos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072431/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671766/","name":"Richard Alan Simmons"}],"duration":"PT1H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Darling Lili
Darling Lili
programme.desc: Darling Lili: Directed by Blake Edwards. With Julie Andrews, Rock Hudson, Jeremy Kemp, Lance Percival. Set during World War I, this movie is a cute spin on the Mata Hari legend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0065611/","name":"Darling Lili","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY2ZDI2NDMtYTc0NC00ODY0LThiODktNzhlZWFjMzk5OWY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set during World War I, this movie is a cute spin on the Mata Hari legend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0065611/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Falco-8"},"dateCreated":"1999-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Who wrote the checks for this dud?","reviewBody":"Julie and Blake deliver a real bomb {no pun intended}of a World War 1 musical with this sloppily made mega budget mess. Julie's voice is always a joy, but the music here is of the "in one ear, out the other" variety. Hudson shows all the romantic magnetism of a buttered scone and his scenes with Julie hold about as much spark as my 1987 Yugo. The comic relief is painfully unfunny, the flying scenes ho hum {with most of the aircraft and even one of the stars, Jeremy Kemp, rehashed from "The Blue Max"}and the whole experience just makes me glad that I saw this on free TV. Its a long way to Tipperary alright, this movie is closer to Verdun...."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Musical"],"datePublished":"1970-06-24","keywords":"louvre museum,war romance,attempted assassination,rain,woman in jeopardy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000267/","name":"Julie Andrews"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001369/","name":"Rock Hudson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0447305/","name":"Jeremy Kemp"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001175/","name":"Blake Edwards"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0155420/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001175/","name":"Blake Edwards"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0087861/","name":"William Peter Blatty"}],"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Man in the White Suit
The Man in the White Suit
programme.desc: The Man in the White Suit: Directed by Alexander Mackendrick. With Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood, Cecil Parker, Michael Gough. An altruistic chemist invents a fabric which resists wear and stain as a boon to humanity, but big business and labor realize it must be suppressed for economic reasons." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0044876/","name":"The Man in the White Suit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNTIzNzY4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODExMTI0NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An altruistic chemist invents a fabric which resists wear and stain as a boon to humanity, but big business and labor realize it must be suppressed for economic reasons.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0044876/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rupie"},"dateCreated":"2000-02-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"another Ealing Studios gem!","reviewBody":"I can't say whether the post-WWII British comedies produced at the Ealing Studios are an acquired taste or not, but I am completely addicted, and The Man in the White Suit is one of the best. No need to go into the well-known plot about the threat posed to both the textile industry and the textile unions by an indestructible, dirt-resistant fiber. Suffice it to say that the slings and arrows suffered by the naively idealistic Sidney Stratton in pursuing his polymer vision make for a comedic delight. Many of the well-known faces from the world of British character actors - the nervous Cecil Parker, the suavely devious Michael Gough, and the bluntly ruthless Ernest Thesinger - put in wonderful performances. Guinness - as always and forever - is superb, and Joan Greenwood is delectable as Daphne (just the way she enunciates the word "Daddy", makes the entire movie worth seeing).\n\n"Knudsen!!!!!!!"","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9348,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1951-12-29","keywords":"invention,capitalism,clothing industry,textile industry,capital vs labor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Man in the White Suit","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi929934873","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5YzFiM2YtN2FmYS00ZGZjLTkxMmMtYzVkNjNhMTE1MGIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5YzFiM2YtN2FmYS00ZGZjLTkxMmMtYzVkNjNhMTE1MGIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Man in the White Suit"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000027/","name":"Alec Guinness"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339343/","name":"Joan Greenwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662116/","name":"Cecil Parker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533241/","name":"Alexander Mackendrick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040024/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532032/","name":"Roger MacDougall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0226538/","name":"John Dighton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533241/","name":"Alexander Mackendrick"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Peeping Tom
Le voyeur
programme.desc: Peeping Tom: Directed by Michael Powell. With Karlheinz Böhm, Moira Shearer, Anna Massey, Maxine Audley. A young man murders women, using a movie camera to film their dying expressions of terror." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054167/","name":"Peeping Tom","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM3ZTAzZDYtZmFjZS00YmQ1LWJlOWEtN2I4MDRmYzY5YmRlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjgyNjk3MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man murders women, using a movie camera to film their dying expressions of terror.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054167/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Bunuel1976"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Peeping Tom (1960)","reviewBody":"I've watched Michael Powell['s PEEPING TOM a couple of times on TV but I've yet to give my Criterion DVD a spin. Certainly one of the most original, challenging and bleakest films ever made and to have come from a British film-maker, albeit an iconoclastic one, makes the achievement all the more remarkable. While I do think that comparisons to its contemporary PSYCHO (1960) are a bit tenuous, it has to be said that both films can be thought of as belonging to the horror genre  in fact, PEEPING TOM was the third British "slasher" movie in a row, following HORRORS OF THE BLACK MUSEUM (1959) and CIRCUS OF HORRORS (1960) - but can also lay claim to being a very dark sort of black comedy. Besides, both films feature dysfunctional, immature, adult male protagonists haunted by a terrible upbringing which vents itself in a series of murders. Furthermore, while both films have been harshly reviled by critics when first released, in time, they have had their reputations make a complete about face and nowadays are numbered among their respective directors' unassailable masterpieces!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1960-05-16","keywords":"serial killer,filmmaking,voyeurism,pornography,peeping tom","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Peeping Tom","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3348824345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzRhNTE1NTMtMWFkMi00NzVmLWExZjAtMzMyNjI4NTYyNTUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzRhNTE1NTMtMWFkMi00NzVmLWExZjAtMzMyNjI4NTYyNTUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Peeping Tom"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003337/","name":"Karlheinz Böhm"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557281/","name":"Anna Massey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790452/","name":"Moira Shearer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003836/","name":"Michael Powell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040391/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548896/","name":"Leo Marks"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

Certainly one of the most original, challenging and bleakest films ever made and to have come from a British film-maker, albeit an iconoclastic one, makes the achievement all the more remarkable. While I do think that comparisons to its contemporary PSYCHO (1960) are a bit tenuous, it has to be said that both films can be thought of as belonging to the horror genre  in fact, PEEPING TOM was the third British "slasher" movie in a row, following HORRORS OF THE BLACK MUSEUM (1959) and CIRCUS OF HORRORS (1960) - but can also lay claim to being a very dark sort of black comedy. Besides, both films feature dysfunctional, immature, adult male protagonists haunted by a terrible upbringing which vents itself in a series of murders. Furthermore, while both films have been harshly reviled by critics when first released, in time, they have had their reputations make a complete about face and nowadays are numbered among their respective directors' unassailable masterpieces!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1960-05-16","keywords":"serial killer,filmmaking,voyeurism,pornography,peeping tom","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Peeping Tom","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3348824345","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzRhNTE1NTMtMWFkMi00NzVmLWExZjAtMzMyNjI4NTYyNTUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzRhNTE1NTMtMWFkMi00NzVmLWExZjAtMzMyNjI4NTYyNTUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Peeping Tom","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003337/","name":"Karlheinz Böhm","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557281/","name":"Anna Massey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790452/","name":"Moira Shearer"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003836/","name":"Michael Powell"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040391/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548896/","name":"Leo Marks"],"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="
